FedProx 98.70±plus-or-minus\pm0.13 7.5e-3±plus-or-minus\pm5.1e-3 87.30±plus-or-minus\pm0.51 3.5e-1±plus-or-minus\pm2.1e-1 62.13±plus-or-minus\pm0.20 1.2e0±plus-or-minus\pm3.1e-1
FedDyn 98.40±plus-or-minus\pm0.23 8.0e-3±plus-or-minus\pm2.1e-3 87.48±plus-or-minus\pm0.31 6.2e-1±plus-or-minus\pm3.5e-1 62.33±plus-or-minus\pm1.15 3.2e0±plus-or-minus\pm8.8e-1
q-FFL 98.72±plus-or-minus\pm0.03 4.7e-3±plus-or-minus\pm1.0e-3 87.35±plus-or-minus\pm0.13 5.1e-1±plus-or-minus\pm5.2e-2 63.33±plus-or-minus\pm0.21 9.4e-1±plus-or-minus\pm3.3e-2
FedFair 98.75±plus-or-minus\pm0.09 3.9e-3±plus-or-minus\pm1.3e-3 87.70±plus-or-minus\pm0.76 2.6e-1±plus-or-minus\pm2.3e-1 62.38±plus-or-minus\pm0.88 8.5e-1±plus-or-minus\pm6.6e-1
references: Performance and Fairness. The experimental results of the FedFair algorithm and baseline methods are shown in Table 1. FedFair notably enhances fairness while maintaining substantial model performance across the MNIST, FashionMNIST, and CIFAR10 datasets, with respective increases of 17.0%, 25.7%, and 9.5%. And Table 2 shows the experimental results of the FedFDP algorithm and baseline methods. Under the same privacy budget, FedFDP demonstrates improvements in model accuracy of 1.2%, 1.8%, and 0.4% compared to the best baseline on the three datasets, while also enhancing fairness by 30.3%, 6.7%, and 27.8% respectively compared to the best baseline.

FedFair notably enhances fairness while maintaining substantial model performance across the MNIST, FashionMNIST, and CIFAR10 datasets, with respective increases of 17.0%, 25.7%, and 9.5%. And Table 2 shows the experimental results of the FedFDP algorithm and baseline methods. Under the same privacy budget, FedFDP demonstrates improvements in model accuracy of 1.2%, 1.8%, and 0.4% compared to the best baseline on the three datasets, while also enhancing fairness by 30.3%, 6.7%, and 27.8% respectively compared to the best baseline.

|ℬi|subscriptℬ𝑖|\mathcal{B}_{i}| Batch size of client i𝑖i, with the mathematical expectation equal to |Di|⋅q⋅subscript𝐷𝑖𝑞|D_{i}|\cdot q

FedDyn 98.40 ||| 8.0e-3 98.36 ||| 1.8e-3 88.26 ||| 3.5e-2 62.33 ||| 9.4e-1 61.35 ||| 2.6e0 62.52 ||| 1.5e0
q-FFL 98.72 ||| 4.7e-3 98.61 ||| 1.1e-3 89.03 ||| 3.6e-2 63.33 ||| 9.4e-1 60.63 ||| 1.3e0 59.65 ||| 1.5e0
FedFair 98.75 ||| 3.9e-3 98.72 ||| 1.2e-3 89.60 ||| 1.7e-2 62.38 ||| 8.5e-1 61.58 ||| 1.1e0 62.90 ||| 1.5e0
references: As shown in Table 4 and 5, we conducted additional experiments on the MNIST, FashionMNIST, and CIFAR10 datasets to compare the performance of FedFDP with that of six other algorithms in terms of Heterogeneity and Scalability. The Heterogeneity experiments were mainly conducted in three heterogeneous scenarios, extending from the default D​i​r​(0.1)𝐷𝑖𝑟0.1Dir(0.1) to include D​i​r​(0.5)𝐷𝑖𝑟0.5Dir(0.5) and D​i​r​(1)𝐷𝑖𝑟1Dir(1). Scalability was expanded from the default 10 clients to include 20 and 50 clients.

Scalability. Table 4 demonstrates that, with accuracy mostly superior to baselines, FedFair exhibited fairness improvements of 9.5%, 15.4%, and 0.01% across three client counts. Table 5 indicates that as the number of clients increases, FedFDP outperformed the best baselines by 0.36%, 0.18%, and 0.59% in accuracy, except in the 50 clients scenario, where it demonstrated fairness improvements of 27.8% and 24.1%.
